thread.title: Iowa HS cross country winner diqualified after helping rival
thread.title_full: Iowa HS cross country winner diqualified after helping rival - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Iowa HS cross country winner diqualified after helping rival
text:
Scot Jackson/Ottumwa Courier Zach Hougland was disqualified after winning a high school cross country race on Thursday after he helped a fellow runner. A high school cross country runner in Iowa was disqualified after winning a race — for helping a competitor who had collapsed.
Zach Hougland of Davis County finished first Thursday in the Class 2A boys district race at Columbus Junction — the precursor for states.
However, when he decided to help Garrett Hinson of Mediapolis, who fell before the finish line, the senior Hougland was disqualified. Iowa High School Athletic Association rules state runners can't help anyone finish the race.
CHECK OUT OUR NEW APP: GET THE DAILY NEWS ON ANDROID OR IOS
"He just wanted to see if he could help the kid," Davis County cross-country coach Josh Husted told the Ottumwa Courier . "The kid put his arms around Zach to help himself up and finished the race. I got called into the field house and was informed that, since the kid finished the race, Zach was considered to have helped him."
Thankfully, Davis County still qualified for states despite his disqualification. Hougland will be able to compete with his teammates on Oct. 31 in Fort Dodge.
